pros: A great place to work and a mission to keep families close.
cons: Can be stressful at times, lots of time working alone or collaboratively with volunteers.

pros: Amazing organization that does amazing things to help families
cons: Poor board members at the time

review_title: Good pay for non for profit, stressful workplace
pros: You get to feel good about your job helping families. Free coffee.
cons: This location was high stress, more to do with the colleagues and too much work, but still worth the time.

pros: Great place to work. Great people.
cons: No cons to share about rmh

pros: Wonderful colleagues and a great mission.

review_title: Good for families, bad for your own mental health
job_title: Fund Development Manager in Edmonton, AB
pros: You are able to be there when families need you most.
cons: Toxic work environment - strong cliques throughout the organization.

pros: flexible benefit program provided by McDonalds Restaurants Canada
cons: half is paid by employee, half is paid by employer

review_title: great cause, rewarding job, low morale on fundraising team
job_title: Business Development Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: this is a great cause provided a much needed service for families with sick kids, passionate staff, rewarding job
cons: fundraising team was overseen by a micro-manager who did not trust the staff, created low morale, resulted in high turnover on this team (this was back in 2006-2010 so things may have changed for the better now); can get emotionally burnt out when you become close with the families whose children pass away

job_title: Family Services Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: Helping families in need at a difficult time in their lives
cons: The CEO has a very short temper and the staff seem to be afraid when she is in the house

pros: It was an amazing organization to be a part of. Working in the same house as the families was inspiring. We got left over from the dinner groups for lunch every day.
cons: The CEO was useless, and during my time at the House, there was extreme turnover. Overall, the company culture was horrible. I constantly felt like I had to defend myself, and my expertise was never taken seriously. I would make suggestions, or implement ideas and be shut down by another employee because they didn't agree, even though I was doing the job I was hired to do.

pros: The idea of this place is awesome, the intent to support families is wonderful. The work that is done is extraordinary and it is a very easy idea to sell and raise money for.
cons: The major challenge with this position was that part-time staff was considered to be 'beneath' regular staff and were treated very poorly. Since I started, the entire organization has seen at least 75 percent turn over. Beware of management, stay on their good side if you want to keep working there.

Management prefers to higher new people rather then promoting and training within. You will often feel like you are not being communicated to. Your pay will be low and your hours long. The  management is more like a social club. If you work in programs you will be working at a shared space, which is rather noisy and sits in the middle of a hall way.
challenging economic environment with elements of dynamic change
low pay bad benefits low working hours

pros: Its ok but really needs to improve
cons: No respect for the employees by managers
